WorkItem.Description: Trying to open my saved priest file in shadow or healer modules created a .NET error. I was on my way in for another stab at it to copy the error text, but now Rawr will not get past the splash screen before going unresponsive. I'm deleting and reinstalling Rawr... soon as I get that done I'll edit in the error text unless someone else beats me to it.
WorkItem.Summary: [HealPriest] Cannot load files from previous version

Comments.Message: Reinstall seems to have fixed it.

Well, pfft.

It might have something to do with switching between modules. What I did - Installed Rawr, set Tools->Options->General to add the three checkboxes, then began loading each pre-saved character file to save the "custom" talent build to the names I use. Open, select file, save talent build, open new without saving old (the talent build still saves).

************** Exception Text **************
System.InvalidOperationException: <CalculationOptionsPriest xmlns=''> was not expected.
   at Microsoft.Xml.Serialization.GeneratedAssembly.XmlSerializationReaderCalculationOptionsHolyPriest.Read4_CalculationOptionsHolyPriest()


************** Loaded Assemblies **************
mscorlib
    Assembly Version: 2.0.0.0
    Win32 Version: 2.0.50727.3082 (QFE.050727-3000)
    CodeBase: file:///c:/WINDOWS/Microsoft.NET/Framework/v2.0.50727/mscorlib.dll
----------------------------------------

When I gave up on trying to mess with the priest module, I tried to load up my druid files and got nailed by the same error. After closing and restarting Rawr yet again, I manually changed the class from priest to druid before attempting to load a file - this worked.

Attaching my files now to see if it's something to do with them.

Anecdotally: tt seems rawr has difficulties going from one class to another, both transitioning when loading a new character,and after exiting and starting a new instance. I'm a little surprised preloads the last loaded set of libraries on startup.
It's definitely not all classes, as I set up my rogue's and druid's (two each) talent builds before moving to the priest, which is where the problem occured.

Doh. This is cause of something I did. There was a typo in the same of the holy priest saved data class, which I fixed. Forgot that it would break save files. I'll put a fix in so that it'll load old files for .17. Sorry. Use new files for the moment.
